The legacy image processor API implemented by the V4L2 image processor

and used by encode accelerators and decode accelerators in ALLOCATE

entry.title: [iOS][ffr] Update gestural IPH dismissal reason
entry.content:
Previously, if any of the following actions caused a gestural IPH to be

dismissed, the dismissal reason would be kUnknown -



1. User opens tab grid

2. User goes to another website

3. User navigates forward/backward

4. User switches tabs by swiping the bottom toolbar

5. User opens new tab

...



All these actions are caused by the user either tapping the bottom

toolbar or the omnibox, both of which are outside of the content area

which the gestural IPH covers. So, effectively, the gestural IPH would

be dismissed with the reason `kTappedOutsideIPHAndAnchorView`.



Bug: b:40276959

Change-Id: Ia05c1b19036ad33c6dfbbf6989e2b998f36028f1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5274003

entry.title: [//gpu] Fold PassthroughAbstractTextureImpl into AbstractTexture
entry.content:
PassthroughAbstractTextureImpl is now the only subclass of

AbstractTexture (this abstraction is used only by //media on desktop,

where the passthrough decoder has fully shipped). This CL folds the

implementation into the interface.



Followup CLs will remove methods that have no-op implementations, as

these are clearly no longer needed.

entry.title: Change chromium-browser-clang/rewrapper_linux.cfg to racing.
entry.content:
I believe that this should be better for most people (everyone?). Using

remote_local_fallback as exec_strategy means that everything that can be

run remotely will be run remotely. When making a full build from

scratch, this is fine, but when recompiling just a few compilation

units, it's typically faster to do it locally. According to my testing,

compiling locally on my machine is about 2 times faster than doing it

remotely. And my machine is 10 years old (i7, 6 cores, 12 threads)! An

even bigger problem occurred when making changes in a large .cc file

that doesn't compile without errors. Then, the compilation unit would

first be compiled remotely, which would of course fail (silently) (and

take a lot of time), but *afterwards* it would fall back to compiling it

locally. I don't know why. To generate the correct error output, maybe?

Anyway, this slowed me down, having to wait for more than a minute, just

to see that my changes didn't compile, and then I'd try again, and

sometimes fail again, and try again, get some coffee while waiting,

forget what I was doing, and lose focus. :)



Changing exec_strategy to "racing" fixes this.



Change-Id: I1a16e01651eb4585888d4ebb36df6d94bb392c11

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277252

Reviewed-by: Takuto Ikuta

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1257816}

entry.title: [siso] Partially support remote alink/solink on Linux
entry.content:
This CL partially supports remote library linking for standard Linux

builds.



Unsupported platforms:

- Mac/Win

- CrOS with custom toolchain, Android



Remote library links are expected to have high cache hit and improve

CQ build speed. But remote links are slower than local links to

upload/download files. So this feature is disabled by default until

I confirm that it doesn't regress build performance.



This feature will be enabled only on the following builders.

So there is no risk to affect prod builds.



- try/fuchsia-binary-size-siso

- try/linux_chromium_compile_siso_dbg_ng

- try/linux_chromium_{asan, tsan}_siso_rel_ng

- build/build-perf-linux-siso

- build/linux-build-perf-developer

- build/linux-chromeos-build-perf-siso



Bug: b/316267242

Change-Id: Iaab6a0813feebd47860d043a899e4804356db454

Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:chromeos-amd64-generic-siso-rel

entry.title: editor: add extra text insertion metrics
entry.content:
Currently we record a number of metrics when text is inserted into a

text input via the feature. There are two states that are not captured

in these metrics which are important steps in the text insertion

process; 1) when the text insertion is requested, and 2) when the text

has been queued for insertion. With this CL these states are now

recorded and can help notify us if there are any issues found with the

current text insertion process.



BUG=b:323717246

entry.title: [FspCache] Add FileSystemProviderCloudFileSystem feature flag
entry.content:
Add the FileSystemProviderCloudFileSystem feature flag. For FspCache

there are now two feature flags:



- FileSystemProviderCloudFileSystem: Enables CloudFileSystem() as a

wrapper for ProvidedFileSystem.



- FileSystemProviderContentCache: Enables the CloudFileSystem()

to use a ContentCache.



FileSystemProviderContentCache is dependent on

FileSystemProviderCloudFileSystem.

entry.title: [SWAutoPreload] Add more crash key and debug code
entry.content:
I noticed SIGBUS happens when accessing the read buffer.



https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?q=product_name+IN+%28%27Chrome_Linux%27%2C%27Chrome_ChromeOS%27%2C%27Chrome_Android%27%29+AND+expanded_custom_data.ChromeCrashProto.magic_signature_1.name%3D%27content%3A%3ARaceNetworkRequestWriteBufferManager%3A%3ACopyAndCompleteWriteDataWithSize%27+AND+expanded_custom_data.ChromeCrashProto.channel%3D%27dev%27+AND+ComparableVersion%28product.Version%29%3E%3DComparableVersion%28%27123.0.6262.5%27%29+AND+ComparableVersion%28product.Version%29%3C%3DComparableVersion%28%27123.0.6272.2%27%29&stbtiq=&reportid=e9d5560578beed5e&index=0#4



This buffer comes from the mojo data pipe without any changes on the

caller side. Add another debug code right after calling the

BeginReadData() to get more clarity on this.



Also this CL fixes the mojo flag misuse, but this doesn't introduce any changes because those values are same internally.

entry.title: Store SlotStart in LightweightQuarantineBranch
entry.content:
Pointer to object may change depending on the MTE tag, but SlotStart does not.



PartitionAllocTest.SchedulerLoopQuarantine was failing because

pointers with the new tags were registered to the branch but we were

checking if the object was quarantined using a pointer with the old tag.



This CL fixes that by storing the SlotStart which doesn't have a tag.

entry.title: [bfcache] Change mojo struct so source location can be passed to the renderer side
entry.content:
This CL is to change the mojo struct `BackForwardCacheNotRestoredReasons` so it can pass source location information (i.e. url, line number, column number) to the renderer side. In a follow-up, we will send the actual source locations of reasons to the renderer's web local frame, so the NotRestoredReasons API can provide source locations.



Before this CL,

- In the mojo struct `BackForwardCacheNotRestoredReasons`, BFCache blocking reasons were represented as a vector of string without source location.

- The message is sent to the renderer side as mojo `CommitNavigationParams`'s not_restored_reasons: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/public/mojom/navigation/navigation_params.mojom;l=595?q=CommitNavigationParams%20-f:out&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc



In this CL,

- The mojo struct has fields for source location, therefore `CommitNavigationParams`'s not_restored_reasons can now contain source location information.

- But, actual source locations are not sent yet.



In follow-up CLs,

- Actual source locations gathered in back_forward_cache_impl.cc will be sent to a web local frame in the renderer.

- The NotRestoredReasons API will provide source locations.





Change-Id: I0c63b19ea3076ffa5aeb734ad87388a285961a3b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5250654

Commit-Queue: Kurumi Muto

Reviewed-by: Fergal Daly

entry.title: editor: record metric when text inserted
entry.content:
Previously we added a number of metrics when a user inserts text using

the feature. This metric was recorded when the InsertText method is

invoked from the UI. However, the text is not necessarily recorded when

this method is called (ie the text insertion may timeout, the focus may

not return to the intended target input). This CL rectifies this by only

recording the metric when we know the text has been inserted

successfully.



BUG=b:323717362

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Properly delete unclaimed PDF streams during frame deletion
entry.content:
Properly delete unclaimed PDF stream infos using the correct embedder

host info.



If a user navigates to a PDF URL, a PDF stream gets created. If the user

closes the tab before the navigation commits, then the stream hasn't

been claimed. PdfViewerStreamManager::RenderFrameDeleted() will try to

delete the stream, but crash, due to the stream being in an unclaimed

state and not being associated with a specific RFH.



Fix this by deleting the unclaimed stream info using the unclaimed

embedder host info.



Rename PdfViewerStreamManager::DeleteStreamInfo() to

PdfViewerStreamManager::DeleteClaimedStreamInfo() and add

PdfViewerStreamManager::DeleteUnclaimedStreamInfo().



Also adjust stale/missing comments regarding the lifetime of the

stream and PdfViewerStreamManager.



Bug: 40944984

Change-Id: I902468f1f6114fe6020ba48bbdeb931998f40f16

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277823

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

entry.title: [base] Do not crash when ThreadPool is configured with >256 cores
entry.content:
This can happen on compute farms and compiling chrome as the ThreadPool

runs as part of the v8_context_snapshot_generator.

This could also happen on test bots that run the TestLauncher on >256

cores.



Simply cap it at 256 for now as that's plenty of threads. We can

revisit if one day that's a limitation for use cases above...



Documented the cap and the fact that approaching this is not a

recommended config for a browser.



R=etiennep@chromium.org

entry.title: Avoid Windows network location permission prompt during casting startup
entry.content:
Creates an WinRT implementation of GetMacSsidMap() in

//chrome/browser/media/router/discovery/ to avoid network location

permission prompts on Win11 24H2. DiscoveryNetworkMonitor uses the

Windows OS API, WlanQueryInterface(), to get the SSID.



On Win11 24H2, Windows prompts for network location permission when apps

use WlanQueryInterface(). In addition to returning the SSID,

WlanQueryInterface() returns information that may be used to determine

network location like the BSSID of the WiFi access point.



This change creates a WinRT implementation of GetMacSsidMap() that uses

the WinRT API IWlanConnectionProfileDetails::GetConnectedSsid() instead

of WlanQueryInterface().

IWlanConnectionProfileDetails::GetConnectedSsid() does not prompt for

location permission because it does not return any additional

information beyond the SSID string.



To reduce risk, this change runs the Winrt code on new Windows Insider

builds only. Older versions of Windows continue using the

existing WlanQueryInterface() code.



Bug: 1502604

Change-Id: If85af43c31ea7d403b7902aab2c9a9b84c9caf8f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5034460

Reviewed-by: Takumi Fujimoto

Commit-Queue: Steve Becker

Reviewed-by: Brandon Maslen

entry.title: Add logic to disable ::webkit-scrollbar styling based on web setting
entry.content:
This is the third of a series of 4 CLs implementing logic that could

allow users to disable custom scrollbar styling based on a web

preference. This is important from an accessibility perspective as

some scrollbars with custom styling can be too low-contrast because the

color contrast is not high enough or the width is too thin.



This CL adds the logic to disable ::webkit prefixed pseudo elements by

adding some new logic to ComputedStyle::HasCustomScrollbarStyles. It

also adds a new VirtualTestSuite `prefers-default-scrollbar-styles`.



Without a UI implementation or an entry in about:flags, there is no

way for users to actually access this setting at this time. But these

changes strive to make that possible for a future implementation.



Bug: 1012117

Change-Id: I882a4091ed7ee020e968a7f05b71d4d473bc4a95

entry.title: Estimate memory cost from Tint objects owned by GPUShaderModule
entry.content:
This helps reduce GPU process memory from blowing up when JS objects

aren't being cleaned up promptly enough. This incurs a small overhead

for extra GC (maybe 1-5% on shader-heavy tests?) but keeps GPU process

memory usage somewhat more stable.



We may actually want to adjust this estimate higher - the GC overhead is

unrealistically low before this change. But we can start with a safer

lower number and watch the impact on OOM frequency in automated tests

(see bug). Ideally we could use a real estimate from Tint itself.



Bug: dawn:2367

entry.title: [exo] Implement zaura_output_manager_v2 protocol server-side
entry.content:
See follow-up CL for exo tests crrev.com/c/5247526.



This CL introduces the zaura_output_manager_v2 protocol to the

aura-shell extension and implements this server-side.



At a high level the protocol uses the global output name to

communicate atomic output config updates without excessive

server<->client round-trips.



Key additions



- OutputConfigurationChange

Struct wrapping added/removed/changed output globals



- AuraOutputManagerV2

Responsible for sending zaura_output_manager_v2 events to bound

clients.

OutputController composes this class to coordinate event

dispatch in response to output configuration changes.



Output configuration updates are communicated to bound clients via

wl_registry.global - output additions

wl_registry.global_remove - output removals

zaura_output_manager_v2.* - output metric changes

zaura_output_manager_v2.done - end of atomic config change



There are two important cases to consider

- Steady state (output changes after client has bound global)

Add / remove / modify events communicated normally

- Initial bind

The client will have already received add events for

active outputs. To complete the atomic config update

AuraOutputManagerV2 sends all active output metrics

immediately after bind.



See go/atomic-output-configuration for more details.



Bug: 1427019, 1408304, 1518335

Change-Id: I1421b34d06373b5e5be1536cd8738f5316265002

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5199307

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Ensure PDFs have loaded in TestPdfViewerStreamManager
entry.content:
In TestPdfViewerStreamManager::WaitUntilPdfLoaded(), wait until the PDF

extension and content has finished loading by using

pdf_extension_test_util::EnsurePDFHasLoaded(). The old version of

WaitUntilPdfLoaded() only waited until the PDF content frame finished

navigating, which was insufficient for some PDF tests.



Change WaitUntilPdfLoaded() and WaitUntilPdfLoadedInFirstChild() to

return the load result.



Now that WaitUntilPdfLoaded() properly waits, use it in

PDFExtensionTestBase::EnsurePDFHasLoadedWithValidFrameTree().

entry.title: Don't invalidate parts after thumb position change
entry.content:
The CL prevents Fluent scrollbar track part from being invalidated

after thumb position changes. Aura scrollbars change arrow buttons

color when the scroll offset changes from and to the min/max scroll

offset. Fluent scrollbars do not change the arrow buttons color

in this case. Thus, we can avoid the redundant invalidation.



Bug: 40286819

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Modify EnsurePDFHasLoaded() to support OOPIF
entry.content:
pdf_extension_test_util::EnsurePDFHasLoaded() will soon be unable to

support OOPIF, since postMessage() support is being restricted. Modify

it to be able to support OOPIF by running a script directly in the

extension frame.



The existing version of EnsurePDFHasLoaded() accesses the PDF

element and sends a postMessage(), which will no longer be accessible

when shadow DOM is added in https://crrev.com/c/5072998. However,

postMessage() will still be accessible if a script is injected into the

PDF extension frame.



Note that TestPdfViewerStreamManager::WaitUntilPdfLoaded() is still

needed, since the new version of EnsurePDFHasLoaded() must directly run

the script in the extension host. The extension host must exist by the

the time EnsurePDFHasLoaded() is used.



Bug: 40268279

Change-Id: Ica67639715ff20e0c1db15670e98c1d9f3f625ab

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5242080

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

entry.title: App Management: Add boilerplate Platform-specific subclasses
entry.content:
This boilerplate establishes separate PageHandler instances for

Windows/Mac/Linux and ChromeOS. Once these are in place, we can begin

moving platform-specific code from the common PageHandler into the

relevant subclass.



Note that in the long-term, we might be able to remove the common Base

class, and just have two implementations of the same interface. In the

meantime, though, this allows us to gradually/safely refactor code

without duplicating it.



Bug: b/317152362

entry.title: [wptrunner] Allow any subtests on test timeout
entry.content:
This matches the `run_web_tests.py` behavior. `run_wpt_tests.py`

previously tried to emulate this in the expectation translation layer,

but handling subtest results on test timeout is fundamentally a decision

that can only be made at runtime. Hook into the testrunner machinery to

do so.



See also: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/44134

entry.title: Sync the limited entropy trial's group assignment between Ash and
entry.content:
LaCrOS.



The client_id and the low entropy source values are already synced

between the Ash Chrome client and the LaCrOS client. This makes sure

that these clients have the same field trial assignments and are treated

as the same client for their metrics. For the same reason, we need these

clients to have the same assignment for the limited entropy synthetic

trial, and this CL adds the syncing of the randomization seed from Ash

Chrome to LaCrOS.



Note that this is a one-way sync (i.e. Ash Chrome generates the value,

and LaCrOS receives, and injects the value into the synthetic trial) and

nothing is being synced from LaCrOS to Ash Chrome. Furthermore, the

valid range for the seed of the limited entropy synthetic trial is

modified to be [1, 100], which used to be [0, 100) - in order to avoid 0

being a valid value. Therefore, when there is not a seed to be synced,

the mojom object will contain a 0 value and it will not be injected into

the trial object on the LaCrOS client.

the price drop if eligible.

entry.title: [Tab Groups] Fix root ID to be the tab ID of a tab in the group
entry.content:
All tabs in a tab group share a root ID. This root ID is supposed to be

the tab ID of one of the tabs in the group.



There are some scenarios like the one highlighted in b/41496085 that

result in this assumption being violated.



This CL makes a change so that when tab state is initialized we run a

simple fixup process where for each tab group we check if any of its

tabs have a tab ID that matches the root ID it is using. If a tab ID

that matches the root ID is found nothing is done. Otherwise the tab ID

of the first tab in the group replaces the root ID of all tabs in the

group so that the assumption that the root ID is the tab ID of one of

the tabs in the group holds true.



This CL also adds a histogram to measure the severity of this problem

to hopefully drive this issue towards 0 over time.



Bug: b/40260089

Change-Id: I6ece28755d24672ffe62fca654526b319914aac6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273029

Reviewed-by: Sky Malice

Commit-Queue: Calder Kitagawa

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1257634}
